column4: hi all; not sure if this is the correct place to ask, but does anyone have a method for extracting jpegs from an online flv presentation?
how do i pass data to it? it's a map viewer.
it's not a movie.
it's not a video stream
that's my problem
http://www.mapjack.com/
what do you need the images for? would a screenshot do the trick?
oh nevermind, beat me to it
they kinda would, but i need the images perspective-corrected
anyway, without the source .fla I don't know of any other way to go about it
actually, can you use a converter of some kind and convert it to a sequence of jpegs, then go through and find the ones you need?
i need to pass location data to the flv in order for it to ask the host server for the correct images. should i be looking into packet forming?
that's what i was thinking; something akin to the way curl can ask for a sequential range of urls

oh, so you dont even have the file locally, ya, I'm afraid you're stuck with screenshots, unless there is enough of them that it really would save you time to automate it in scripting lang of your choice
well, i can get the file locally, but that doesn't help anything
right, cause it needs data
script it or continue on with your evening of screenshots
i'm wondering how hard it would be to write my own javascript for this
if I were you, depending on how many there were to do, I would automate the whole process with python, or java using xuggler. but I'm a developer
i'm looking into their javascript at the moment
great minds, etc.
what do you develop?
I'm currently paid to write java, but I use multiple languages
